ExampleDefinition.Description:
The Tenor Curves example demonstrates how to combine 3D Charts and 2D Charts in the same example, in this case to display sample tenor curve data.
3D Charts are provided by the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.SciChart3DSurface.html']SciChart3DSurface Type[/url]. In this example we use a [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.Model.UniformGridDataSeries3D%603.html']UniformGridDataSeries3D[/url] and a [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.RenderableSeries.SurfaceMeshRenderableSeries3D.html']SurfaceMeshRenderableSeries3D[/url] to visualize the 3D surface. Rotation of the 3D chart is provided by the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.Modifiers.OrbitModifier3D.html']OrbitModifier3D[/url].
2D Line Charts are provided by the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.SciChartSurface.html']SciChartSurface[/url]. This uses a single [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.RenderableSeries.FastLineRenderableSeries.html']FastLineRenderableSeries[/url] and [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Model.DataSeries.XyDataSeries%602.html']XyDataSeries[/url] type to display line data, with an optional [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.PointMarkers.BasePointMarker.html']PointMarker[/url].
